title: Lions use dominant rushing attack, relentless pass rush to grab big road win
content: Detroit overwhelmed Baltimore at the line of scrimmage to pull away for a big early-season road victory.

title: Sources: VanVleet has torn ACL, may miss season
content: Rockets star guard Fred VanVleet suffered a torn ACL during a recent workout and could potentially miss the entirety of the 2025-26 season, sources told ESPN.

title: Pearl steps down after 11 seasons at Auburn
content: Bruce Pearl has stepped down as the men's hoops coach at Auburn and will move into an ambassador's role in the athletic department as special assistant to the athletics director, the school announced Monday.

title: Ravens' Henry baffled by third fumble in 3 games
content: Running back Derrick Henry's third fumble in three games played a pivotal role in the Baltimore Ravens' 38-30 loss to the Detroit Lions Monday night. He told reporters after the defeat that "I'm at a loss for words. ... I ain't going to lie to y'all."

title: 49ers DE Bosa out for season with torn right ACL
content: 49ers Pro Bowl defensive end Nick Bosa tore his right ACL during Sunday's 16-15 victory against the Cardinals at Levi's Stadium, and he will need season-ending surgery.

title: Falcons fire WR coach Hilliard after offense flops
content: The Falcons fired wide receivers coach Ike Hilliard on Monday, one day after being routed by the Panthers, the team announced.

title: Chargers RB Harris out for year, Harbaugh says
content: Tests confirmed that Los Angeles Chargers running back Najee Harris, who collapsed on a play in the second quarter Sunday during his team's win over the Denver Broncos, suffered a season-ending torn Achilles, coach Jim Harbaugh said Monday.

title: Cowboys' Jones: IR a consideration for WR Lamb
content: Cowboys Pro Bowl wide receiver CeeDee Lamb could miss three to four weeks because of a high left ankle sprain suffered in Sunday's loss to the Bears, according to a source.

title: Pack's LaFleur wasn't happy with undefeated talk
content: Packers coach Matt LaFleur said Monday that he wasn't happy with the "undefeated" talk coming from the locker room last week.

title: üèÜRanking A'ja Wilson's WNBA MVP seasons
content: A year ago, A'ja Wilson played arguably the best season in WNBA history. Where does her 2025 MVP season rank?

content: The Tigers' winningest coach is retiring. Here's what that means with 42 days until the 2025-26 season tips off.

content: Team USA and Europe will meet at Bethpage Black for Ryder Cup bragging rights. We're breaking down every player competing in this year's tournament.

content: Team Europe, amid its recent success at home, has managed just four victories overseas against Team USA.

content: Forget the MVP and Cy Young Award races -- it's time for our fun and wide-ranging regular-season annual accolades.

content: Whether he starts Game 1 on the mound or pitches in relief, Shohei Ohtani is primed to make even more history.

content: Putting the spotlight on select teams and questions around others as the early playoff picture takes shape.

content: We're counting down the top 100 players in the league for the 2025-26 season. What players broke into Nos. 100 to 51?

content: Highlighting available free agent options after yet another injury-filled weekend, as well as other helpful options ahead of Week 4.

content: Kelsey Mitchell and Indiana stunned Las Vegas in Game 1. What's next for both teams in the WNBA semifinals?

content: With pink hair, lively banter and bold basketball, Courtney Williams and Natisha Hiedeman champion Black, gay, masc representation in the WNBA.

title: Offseason survey: Best and worst moves, LeBron's future and Finals picks
content: League insiders share their picks for the Finals, most head-scratching moves of the summer and LeBron's next decision.

title: Why Demb√©l√©'s Ballon d'Or win over Yamal feels like the dawn of a new era
content: Ousmane Demb√©l√© and Lamine Yamal, this year's top two in the Ballon d'Or voting, have a lot in common when it comes to how their energetic, attacking play is a welcome antidote in the tactics-driven world of modern soccer.

title: What makes Barcelona's Ballon d'Or winners Bonmati and Lopez so special?
content: Barcelona wrapped up both the main Ballon d'Or prize and the Kopa Trophy for best U21 player. But what is it about Aitana Bonmati and Vicky Lopez that makes them stand out?

title: The VAR Review: Explaining Bruno Fernandes' 'offside,' Robert S√°nchez's red card, Newcastle's penalty claim
content: Looking at Robert S√°nchez's red card for Chelsea at Manchester United, a possible offside on Bruno Fernandes' goal and a potential penalty.

title: MLS: How high can LAFC climb with Son leading a dynamic attack?
content: Pairing Son Heung-min with Denis Bouanga has given LAFC one of the most fearsome attacks in the league, but were they able to break into the top five of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings?

title: NWSL: Marta's Orlando Pride in nine-game rut
content: Orlando have stretched their winless rut to a calamitous nine straight games and are desperately clinching on to a playoff position. That and more in ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings.

title: College football betting: Is it time to buy into Fernando Mendoza and the Hoosiers?
content: As the odds shift each week for the coveted Heisman Trophy and national championship, Pamela Maldonado explains how to bet each of them.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Vin√≠cius Jr's future at Madrid in doubt
content: Vin√≠cius J√∫nior's future at Real Madrid reportedly remains uncertain with his contract expiring in 2027. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Fantasy basketball roundtable: Should you draft Cooper Flagg in the third round?
content: Our experts weigh in on the No. 1 pick of the 2025 NBA draft and what type of fantasy production they expect out of him as a rookie.

title: Fantasy basketball: Sleepers, breakouts and busts for 2025-26
content: Which fantasy basketball players are going to exceed expectations in 2025-26? Our experts list their picks.

title: Plant my flag list: Greg Wyshynski's 10 must-draft players
content: Greg Wyshynski reveals the 10 players he's queuing up in every one of his fantasy hockey drafts this season.

title: Four-team mock draft strategy: When to draft Tkachuk, Kucherov and others
content: Four-team leagues are rising in popularity, so our experts mock drafted their teams for a H2H points league.

title: Maha shocker: BJP workers make Cong leader wear sari over PM photo; oppn fumes
content: A political controversy erupted in Dombivli after a Congress worker shared a morphed image of Prime Minister Modi in a sari, triggering strong condemnation from BJP cadres. BJP workers allegedly retaliated by forcing the Congress worker to wear a sari, leading to protests and clashes between the two parties.

title: 'Revolt from within': BJP targets Rahul; Tewari's 'dynast' post sparks row
content: Congress MP Manish Tewari's remarks about youth-led protests against entitlement in South Asia have sparked a political row. The BJP interpreted Tewari's comments as a dig at Rahul Gandhi, labeling him the "ultimate nepo kid." Tewari countered, urging the BJP to focus on the serious national security implications of the regional unrest, while defending his statement.

title: UAE visa ban: Bangladesh ambassador to UAE denies reports; says ‚Äòfake news‚Äô
content: Bangladesh's Ambassador to the UAE, Tareq Ahmed, refuted reports of a visa ban on Bangladeshi nationals, dismissing them as 'inauthentic.' While social media circulated claims of a ban impacting nine countries, including Bangladesh, UAE authorities have not confirmed any new directives. Discussions are ongoing to ease visa processes, aiming for Bangladeshi citizens to contribute to the UAE's success.

title: ‚ÄòSeemanchal Nyay Yatra‚Äô: Owaisi to launch AIMIM‚Äôs 4-day campaign in Bihar from Sept 24
content: Asaduddin Owaisi, the AIMIM president, is set to launch his party's Bihar Assembly election campaign with a four-day "Seemanchal Nyay Yatra" from September 24-27, focusing on the Seemanchal region. The Yatra aims to unite people for the development of the backward region, with Owaisi criticizing the BJP's caste politics. In the 2020 elections, AIMIM won five seats from Seemanchal and plans to contest more in 2025.

title: ‚ÄòCame out of the blue‚Äô: JPMorgan CEO on H-1B fee hike, calls US immigrant nation
content: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon expressed surprise at the sudden H-1B visa fee hike implemented by the Trump administration, emphasizing the visa's importance for global talent mobility within the bank. Dimon highlighted the US as an immigrant nation, advocating for merit-based immigration and indicating that businesses will engage with the government to address concerns arising from the new fee.

title: Delhi: Over 150 report sick after consuming kuttu atta in Jahangirpuri
content: In northwest Delhi, approximately 200 individuals have reportedly fallen ill due to suspected food poisoning linked to buckwheat flour consumption during Navratri fasting. Authorities were alerted early Tuesday morning, with affected individuals from areas like Jahangirpuri seeking treatment at BJRM Hospital.

title: J&K: Soldier dies in Udhampur after gunshot; probe under way
content: In Udhampur, Jammu and Kashmir, a soldier tragically died from a gunshot wound sustained from his own service rifle outside a military hospital on Tuesday. The soldier, a driver, was waiting in a vehicle when the incident occurred.

title: 'Roads near PM Modi's house also have potholes': DKS to IT companies in Bengaluru
content: Deputy CM D K Shivakumar addresses Karnataka's pothole issue, stating it's a nationwide problem, not unique to the state, and the government is actively working on repairs. He criticizes the BJP's past inaction and accuses them of politicizing the issue ahead of elections. His remarks follow concerns raised by industry leaders and a planned BJP road blockade protest.

title: H-1B visa hike: White House raises alarm; Says 40,000 US tech jobs lost to foreigners
content: President Trump introduced a $100,000 fee for H-1B visa applications, citing program abuse and American job losses. The White House claims companies are replacing American tech workers with lower-paid foreign labor, impacting national security. Trump aims to protect American workers by increasing costs for companies utilizing the H-1B program and prioritizing American-born workers in employment gains.

title: Think 63 to retire: Hidden financial dangers; experts reveal smarter age
content: Many Americans aim for early retirement around 63, but financial experts advise caution. Retiring too early can lead to reduced Social Security benefits, higher healthcare costs before Medicare, and the risk of outliving savings. Delaying retirement until 65-67 offers increased financial security through higher benefits and Medicare eligibility, ensuring a more stable and enjoyable post-work life.

title: ‚ÄòMatter of relief & joy‚Äô: Akhilesh Yadav welcomes Azam Khan‚Äôs release from jail
content: Akhilesh Yadav expressed relief and gratitude for Azam Khan's release from Sitapur jail, criticizing the BJP for filing false cases. Shivpal Singh Yadav echoed these sentiments, asserting the Samajwadi Party's unwavering support for Khan. After nearly two years in custody facing numerous charges, Khan's release was met with large gatherings of supporters.

title: ‚ÄòI did it out of curiosity‚Äô: Afghan teen hides in plane‚Äôs gear; lands in Delhi
content: A 13-year-old Afghan boy was discovered at Delhi airport after stowing away in the landing gear compartment of a Kam Air flight from Kabul. The boy, who claimed he acted out of curiosity, was found after the flight landed and was questioned by security.

title: Fact check: Does Ind vs Pak third umpire have IPL contract as claimed by ex-players?
content: The dismissal of Fakhar Zaman during the India vs Pakistan Asia Cup match has sparked controversy, with Pakistani players and former cricketers questioning the third umpire's decision. Concerns centre on the legitimacy of Sanju Samson's catch and the limited camera angles used for review. At the heart of the controversy is umpire Ruchira Palliyaguruge of Sri Lanka.

title: Siddaramaiah writes to Azim Premji; seeks Wipro‚Äôs support in tackling traffic
content: Karnataka's Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has requested Wipro founder Azim Premji's assistance in alleviating Bengaluru's Outer Ring Road traffic congestion. The appeal follows criticism regarding the city's infrastructure, with the CM suggesting limited vehicular access through Wipro's campus could reduce congestion by 30%.

title: Peacocks and protests: Rahul links unemployment to 'vote chori'; takes jibe at PM Modi
content: Rahul Gandhi criticized the Modi government, linking rising unemployment and corruption to alleged electoral malpractices. He accused the BJP of prioritizing image management and corporate interests over youth employment, highlighting a split-screen video contrasting police action against protesting students with the Prime Minister's public relations activities. Gandhi asserted that young Indians will no longer tolerate "job theft" or "vote theft."

title: Movie tickets to not cost more than Rs 200? K'taka HC says no; stays state govt order
content: The Karnataka High Court has temporarily suspended the state government's order that capped cinema ticket prices at Rs 200. This decision follows petitions from multiplexes, theatre owners, and film producers who argued the cap was arbitrary and detrimental to their business. The court's intervention puts the price regulation on hold, pending further deliberation on its validity and impact.

title: Zubeen Garg's death: Why Assam govt ordered 2nd autopsy?
content: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma announced a second autopsy for Zubeen Garg, responding to public demand and his family's consent, following his death in Singapore. A holiday is declared in Kamrup (Metro) for his cremation. The post-mortem will be at GMCH, with AIIMS doctors present. The state will live-stream the funeral and construct memorials.

title: 'Afridi treated like net-ball spinner': Gavaskar hails India's match-winner
content: Sunil Gavaskar praised Tilak Varma's fearless batting after India's dominant Asia Cup victory over Pakistan. Varma's audacious strokes against Shaheen Shah Afridi sealed the win, leaving Gavaskar impressed. India's strong opening partnership and Pakistan's struggles with the ball further contributed to India's commanding performance, positioning them favourably in the Super 4 standings.

title: Harbhajan Singh mocks Pak, deletes 'greatest' from 'greatest rivalry'
content: Following India's dominant six-wicket victory over Pakistan in the Asia Cup 2025, captain Suryakumar Yadav questioned the notion of a meaningful rivalry between the two nations. He highlighted India's overwhelming 12-3 record in T20Is and seven consecutive wins since the 2022 T20 World Cup, suggesting a significant imbalance in competitiveness.

title: Paracetamol harmful for pregnant women? Trump links it to autism
content: During a White House press conference, Donald Trump controversially linked acetaminophen use during pregnancy to increased autism risk, a claim conflicting with medical consensus. He advised limiting Tylenol, echoing concerns about vaccines promoted by Robert F Kennedy Jr. Trump's statements, lacking medical evidence, suggested delayed vaccinations and questioned combination shots.

title: MAGA tale: How Obama 'birthed' Trump; and destroyed Dems
content: Barack Obama, hailed as the ‚ÄúChosen One,‚Äù broke the American political machine by turning charisma into consensus and spectacle into governance. His presidency mainstreamed cultural victories but torched bipartisanship, replacing incremental change with identity politics and leaving conservatives convinced their America had been stolen. Donald Trump was not an aberration but the sequel: he exaggerated Obama‚Äôs template, weaponising resentment, chaos, and survival as legitimacy. Together, they forged a feedback loop where politics became existential theatre. Obama made history, Trump turned it into farce ‚Äî and America, caught between poetry and parody, may never recover its lost consensus.

title: One-time H-1B fees: How MEA engaged with Trump govt to win relief; details here
content: The Indian IT sector breathed a sigh of relief after the White House clarified that the proposed $100,000 H-1B visa fee applies only to new applicants, not existing holders, and is a one-time charge. Extensive engagement by the External Affairs Ministry with the Trump administration led to this clarification.

title: Customs raids homes of actors Dulquer, Prithviraj in vehicle smuggling case
content: Customs officials in Kerala are conducting raids across 30 locations, including the residences of actors Dulqar Salman and Prithviraj, as part of "Operation Numkhor." This operation targets the alleged illegal import of approximately 100 premium, second-hand vehicles from Bhutan.

title: Ragging horror in TN: ITI student forced to undress, beaten in hostel room
content: Tamil Nadu police have filed a case against three minors after a disturbing video surfaced showing an ITI student being stripped and assaulted within a government-run hostel in Madurai district. The victim was forced to undress and subjected to physical abuse, including being struck with a slipper.

title: 'Troubling elements': Tharoor urges caution on Saudi-Pakistan defence pact; urges faith in govt
content: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has advised caution regarding the recent Saudi-Pakistan defence pact, emphasizing the importance of trusting India's diplomatic efforts. He acknowledged the agreement as a continuation of a long-standing relationship, while also noting some concerning elements, particularly the mutual defence clause. The Ministry of External Affairs has confirmed that it will closely study the agreement‚Äôs implications.

title: SP leader Azam Khan walks out of Sitapur jail after 23 months
content: Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan was released from Sitapur jail after 23 months, greeted by supporters amid tight security. He had secured bail in all cases, including those reopened by Rampur police. Despite facing 111 criminal cases, Khan's lawyer is challenging additional charges in the Supreme Court, alleging attempts to prolong his imprisonment.

title: R Ashwin gears up for new overseas challenge ‚Äì major update revealed
content: Ravichandran Ashwin, after retiring from international cricket and the IPL, is embarking on a busy second innings. He's set to participate in both the ILT20 in the UAE and the Big Bash League in Australia, attracting interest from multiple BBL franchises. Before these commitments, Ashwin will also represent India at the Hong Kong Sixes, adding star value to the side.

title: Watch: Zubeen Garg's wife Garima Saikia breaks down during his last rites
content: Zubeen Garg, the Assamese singer, was cremated in Guwahati. The cremation took place with Vedic hymns and tributes. His wife, Garima Saikia Garg, was present. Dignitaries like Sarbananda Sonowal and Himanta Biswa Sarma participated. The Assam Police gave a gun salute. Family and well-wishers chanted slogans and sang his songs. A sandalwood branch he planted was also offered.

title: Kolkata flooded: Pandals submerged, streets underwater, cars stranded - videos show havoc
content: Kolkata faced immense disruption as torrential overnight rainfall led to widespread flooding, paralyzing the city. Public transport, including trains and Metro services, was suspended, and streets became submerged, stranding vehicles. Tragically, at least three people died due to electrocution in the rain-affected areas. The IMD has warned of continued heavy rainfall in several South Bengal districts.

title: ACP's Thar mows down property dealer in Faridabad
content: In Faridabad, a property dealer was fatally run over by a Thar SUV allegedly connected to a local ACP, prompting a murder investigation focusing on the ACP's son. Separately, in Lucknow, a speeding Thar struck an e-rickshaw, killing two and critically injuring four devotees. The driver, a 19-year-old Merchant Navy student, has been arrested as investigations continue into both incidents.

title: National film awards: Shah Rukh, Mohanlal & others to receive - when & where you can watch
content: Shah Rukh Khan's first National Award win after 33 years highlights the 71st National Film Awards. The ceremony, scheduled for September 23, 2025, in New Delhi, will be hosted by President Droupadi Murmu. '12th Fail' won Best Feature Film, with Shah Rukh Khan and Vikrant Massey sharing Best Actor. The event will be streamed live on DD News YouTube.

title: 'Go to Pakistan': Imam thrashed, forced to chant ‚ÄòJai Shri Ram‚Äô in Aligarh
content: An imam in Aligarh, Uttar Pradesh, was allegedly assaulted and told to go to Pakistan for refusing to chant ‚ÄòJai Shri Ram‚Äô. Mohammed Mustakeem reported the incident occurred on September 20th. While police claim it was a simple assault with no religious motive, the Jamiat Ulema-e-Hind alleges a cover-up, stating the imam is hospitalized.

title: Farewell Zubeen: Lakhs gather for Assam's beloved singer's final journey
content: Assam mourns the loss of Zubeen Garg, a celebrated singer and composer, with a state funeral planned in Kamarkuchi village. Thousands of fans paid their respects in Guwahati, while Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma oversaw arrangements and tributes poured in. A second post-mortem was conducted for transparency, and memorials were held across the state to honor Zubeen's legacy.

title: It's official! Katrina Kaif, Vicky Kaushal announce pregnancy: 'best chapter of our lives'
content: Vicky Kaushal and Katrina Kaif have officially announced they are expecting their first child. The couple shared the joyous news with a heartwarming picture on Instagram, where they are seen wearing matching white outfits. In the picture, Vicky is tenderly cradling Katrina's baby bump. Read the full article to know more.

title: Watch: Protests sweep Italy over Gaza war; call to recognise Palestine
content: Massive protests erupted across Italy due to the Gaza crisis. Workers and protesters mobilised, leading to strikes and transport disruptions. Milan saw clashes with police as demonstrators stormed a train station. Unions demanded Italy sever ties with Israel. Demonstrations occurred in Rome, Bologna, Turin, and other cities. Dock workers slowed operations at ports.

title: Haris Rauf made jets downing gesture not once but twice against India - watch
content: Pakistani fast bowler Haris Rauf ignited controversy during the Asia Cup Super 4s match against India with politically charged gestures, including mimicking fighter jet crashes and displaying '6-0' signals towards Indian fans, referencing unverified claims about downing Indian jets during Operation Sindoor.

title: Boardroom slogans, broken payslips: Why India‚Äôs gender pay gap won‚Äôt budge
content: Despite the rhetoric of empowerment echoing through boardrooms, India‚Äôs gender pay gap remains glaring. Women continue to earn significantly less, with the IT sector emerging as the worst offender, followed by real estate, FMCG, and banking. Career breaks and workplace bias drive the disparity, while professionals demand pay transparency and performance-based growth to break entrenched inequities.

title: Congress free to take credit for GST reforms if they feel people are happy: BJP
content: Sambit Patra said the opposition party is free to take credit for it by putting up banners and hoardings "thanking" PM Modi if they feel people are happy with the reforms.

title: Karnataka High Court stays government‚Äôs rule capping cinema ticket price at ‚Çπ200
content: The petitioners have questioned the legality of the amendment made to the Karnataka Cinema (Regulation) Rules with effect from September 12, capping the prices of the tickets at ‚Çπ200, except in multiple-screen cinemas with premium facilities of 75 seats or less

title: War of words between AAP and BJP over attack on activist
content: AAP Goa vice-president Chetan Kamat responded to state BJYM chief Tushar Kelkar‚Äôs claim that Venzy Viegas and others trespassed during a protest condemning the assault on Mr. Kankonkar last week

title: Arrangements for Banni festival reviewed
content: The annual festival conducted on the Dasara day sees large number of people from four villages vie with each other to take possession of the deities of Mala Malleswara Swamy leading to injuries, sometimes death, of villagers

title: 2 dead as three-storey building collapses in Indore; tenant claims he had warned landlord about danger
content: The landlord had been warned a week ago about the dilapidated condition of the three-storey building.

title: Shashi Tharoor says H-1B visa fee hike driven by Donald Trump's domestic politics
content: Shashi Tharoor criticises U.S. President Donald Trump‚Äôs H-1B visa fee hike as a move to please anti-immigration supporters, risking U.S. economy

title: Trump‚Äôs H-1B fee hike: Types of U.S. work visas for Indians
content: Among the various employment visa categories, such as H-1B, L, O, and P, the H-1B remains the most sought-after by Indian professionals

title: Rebels float new front as UDF faces fresh challenge in Kannur Corporation in Kerala
content: Congress rebels and disgruntled leaders expelled from various parties prepare to enter the fray under the banner Rajivji Cultural Forum

title: Cutting down on imports and increasing exports biggest form of nationalism: Gadkari
content: Gadkari said that a country advancing in knowledge and research will emerge as a 'Vishwaguru', stressing the need to link education and innovation with national development

title: Falling exports of tariff-free products to U.S. cause of concern: Congress
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said an analysis by the respected New Delhi-based research outfit GTRI is a cause for concern, even if the data is only for four months

title: T.N. CM Stalin slams PM Modi‚Äôs statement on ‚Çπ2.5 lakh crore savings from GST reforms and IT relief
content: ‚ÄúThis is exactly what the Opposition has been demanding from the very beginning. If these measures had been taken eight years ago, families across the country would already have saved many lakh crores more,‚Äù he said

title: Ayushman Bharat effected revolution in public healthcare: PM Modi
content: The medical insurance scheme provides annual health cover of ‚Çπ5 lakh and covers the poor and all senior citizens above the age of 70

title: Study finds the Ganga river is drying faster than in 1,300 years
content: Scientists found that between 1991 and 2020, the Ganga basin experienced four- to seven-year droughts much more often than in the previous millennium

title: IAF‚Äôs famed helicopter display team Sarang to participate in Mysuru Dasara festivities
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah had personally met Defence Minister Rajnath Singh with a request to facilitate the air show during the Dasara festivities

title: North Chennai residents oppose Kodungaiyur WTE plant citing CPCB report on fly ash contamination in Hyderabad units
content: The CPCB, in its submission to the National Green Tribunal (NGT), recorded cadmium levels of 858.65 mg/kg in fly ash from the Jawaharnagar plant and 956.69 mg/kg from the Dundigal facility in Hyderabad

title: India to hold biggest drone, counter-drone drill since Operation Sindoor ‚Äî ‚ÄòCold Start‚Äô in October
content: A senior official said the upcoming exercise will focus on evaluating operational readiness against evolving aerial threats

title: Madras High Court-ordered inquiry confirms Kancheepuram judge remanded DSP over personal row with former PSO
content: Justice N. Sathish Kumar directs Registry to place the inquiry report before the Vigilance Committee comprising senior judges of the High Court

title: ‚ÄòFraud‚Äô against NCR homebuyers: Supreme Court nod to CBI to register six more cases in builder-bank ‚Äònexus‚Äô
content: The Supreme Court is hearing a batch of petitions filed by over 1,200 homebuyers, who booked flats under the subvention plans in various housing projects in NCR

title: Teachers protest against social and educational survey duties in Karnataka
content: They refused to go door-to-door for the survey, saying Education Department officials had given them mandatory duty slips, despite their illness, old age or disabilities

title: Ragging in Madurai: Teen student stripped, thrashed by batchmates at government ITI hostel
content: The victim boy, a first year student at the ITI, hails from Varusanadu in Theni district and was staying in the students‚Äô hostel run by the Tamil Nadu government‚Äôs Department of Kallar Reclamation

title: Around 200 fall ill after consuming buckwheat flour in Delhi, probe underway: Police
content: The patients hailing from various areas, including Jahangirpuri, Mahendra Park, Samaypur, Bhalswa Dairy, Lal Bagh and Swaroop Nagar, were found stable and no serious case was reported

title: City Gas Distribution facility to be developed at Bengaluru Airport City
content: The proposed facility will include a Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) station and associated infrastructure, Piped Natural Gas (PNG) installations, and other clean energy solutions

title: Ayodhya mosque plan rejected by development authority over pending NOCs: RTI reply
content: Ayodhya Development Authority rejects mosque construction plan due to lack of government department clearances, sparking controversy

title: Watch: Young talents, big dreams inside a rehabilitation camp for Sri Lankan refugees near Chennai
content: At the rehabilitation camp for Sri Lankan Tamil refugees in Puzhal near Chennai, young dreams shine bright. A young dancer hopes to learn Bharatanatyam, a rising 12-year-old footballer is already making his mark on the field, and Nivetha crafts eco-friendly baskets with her friends. Despite challenges, these stories of resilience and talent show that refugee communities are full of hope, skill, and untapped potential for the future.

title: Courts cannot act as recovery agents for collection of money: Supreme Court
content: These observations were made in a criminal case arising in Uttar Pradesh, where the bench noted that kidnapping charges were alleged against an individual, in a dispute over recovery of money

title: Chennai-based diabetologist featured in list of top 2% of global scientists
content: Dr. Mohan, also chief diabetologist at Dr. Mohan‚Äôs Diabetes Specialities Centre, has been featured on this list in previous years as well

title: IIT Madras-incubated Wankel Energy Systems secures $1 million pre-seed funding
content: The funding will help the startup, which aims to prevent the loss of potential energy in pressure-reducing valves (PRVs), go global.

title: Criminal past alone cannot be a ground to deny bail, says Supreme Court judgment
content: A Bench headed by Justice Dipankar Datta, in a recent judgment, set aside a Kerala High Court decision in 2024, overturning the bail granted to the five men of a total 10 accused persons in the case

title: Doddasaggere botanical garden in Karnataka sees rise in number of species, including near-threatened and rare ones
content: Doddasaggere Botanical Garden, planned to be developed on 228 acres,¬†would be the second biggest botanical garden in¬†Karnataka, and the third biggest in India

title: Constable posted outside Haryana minister's Gurugram residence found dead
content: The constable was deployed as the security personnel outside Narbir Singh‚Äôs residence in the civil lines area after he became a minister following the 2024 assembly elections, police said

title: 1xBet online betting app case: Directorate of Enforcement records statement of cricketer Yuvraj Singh
content: The agency questioned the all-rounder and left-hand batter and recorded his statement under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), the officials said

title: Unemployment biggest problem facing youth, it is directly linked to 'vote chori': Rahul
content: When a Government wins public trust and comes to power, its first duty is to provide employment and opportunities to the youth, Rahul said.

title: All accused in social media slander case against Kerala CPI(M) leader K.J. Shine fail to appear before SIT
content: SIT had issued notices to C.K. Gopalakrishnan, K.M. Shajahan, and Yasar to appear at Aluva cyber police station on Tuesday morning

title: AIADMK cadre give warm welcome to Palaniswami in Sengottaiyan‚Äôs turf Gobichettipalayam
content: This was Mr. Palaniswami‚Äôs first visit to the constituency after the removal of Mr. Sengottaiyan from his party posts

title: Assam‚Äôs Zubeen Garg cremated with State honours
content: Thousands of fans followed the ambulance carrying his mortal remains to the cremation spot in Sonapur, 30 km east of Guwahati

title: Minor volcanic eruptions noticed in Andaman‚Äôs Barren Island
content: Barren Island in Andaman and Nicobar Islands experiences minor volcanic eruptions, India‚Äôs only active volcano, officials report

title: Tamil Nadu Assembly session from October 14: Speaker
content: The supplementary budget estimates for 2025-26 will be presented in the House during the session, M. Appavu said

title: Forest (Amendment) Bill offers new hope for Sandalwood farmers in Kerala
content: The Bill has provisions for the sale of sandalwood trees on private land through the Forest depots, and the price of the timber will be made available to the farmer.

title: Customs raids Dulquer Salmaan, Prithviraj Sukumaran‚Äôs residences over illegally imported premium vehicles in Kerala
content: Residences and premises of high-net-worth individuals in Kerala, including prominent actors and industrialists, were raided as part of a crackdown on the alleged illegal import of premium vehicles numbering over 100 from Bhutan

title: IIIT-Bangalore develops smart panels to boost 5G and shape 6G networks
content: One of the biggest advantages of these panels is that they can be easily added to existing 5G-Advanced networks

title: At least five killed in Kolkata as overnight torrential rains lash the city and its suburbs
content: The city received about 247. 5 mm rainfall in the past 24 hours leading to waterlogging in several neighbourhoods. Kolkata Mayor Firhad Hakim urged people to stay indoors. The deaths were due to electrocution

title: Kolkata rains LIVE: Over 30 flights cancelled; West Bengal declares Puja holidays two days ahead of schedule
content: In western Maharashtra, torrential rains over the past 24 hours left one person dead and 14 people stranded¬†in¬†floodwaters

title: Bengaluru study finds children in urban slums suffering from ‚Äòmoderate child food poverty‚Äô despite government nutrition programmes
content: Children from poorer households, nuclear families, and with less-educated mothers were more at risk. Food restrictions during illness further worsened nutrition, said the study

title: Opposition slams U.P. Government‚Äôs ban on caste-based political rallies, calls move an ‚Äòeyewash‚Äô
content: The Congress described the decision as dangerous and an eyewash to silent voices emerging from the Dalit, backwards, marginalised and other subaltern communities.

title: Over 1.37 lakh metric tonnes of fresh fruit, including apples, dispatched outside Kashmir in 10 days: J&K Government
content: The movement of fresh fruit, especially apples, was halted due to heavy rains that resulted in the closure of the Srinagar-Jammu National Highway for three weeks

title: H-1B‚Äôs new $100k visa fee: Why young Indian women are most at risk
content: The impact will be particularly felt by women H-1B beneficiaries as they generally earn less than men

title: Heavy rain likely in Odisha due to fresh low-pressure area over Bay of Bengal
content: Heavy rainfall would occur in the districts of Sundargarh, Sambalpur, Deogarh, Keonjhar, Mayurbhanj, Jharsuguda, Angul, Boudh, Sonepur, Malkangiri, Koraput, Nabarangpur, and Kalahandi on September 23

title: Focus is on IT, but not at the cost of agriculture, says A.P. CM Naidu ¬†
content: Naidu asks MLAs and MLCs to spend a day every month in the fields, interact with the farmers and solve their problems

title: Under BJP rule, Odisha reports 37,611 crimes against women in just 14 months
content: Molestation tops the list with 9,181 cases, followed by abduction of women (8,227), non-dowry torture (6,134), and dowry torture (5,464).

title: NC MP Ruhullah seeks immediate, unconditional release of rights activist¬†Khurram Parvez
content: For over 1,400 days, the BJP-RSS regime has kept Kashmiri human rights defender Khurram Parvez in unlawful captivity, says National Conference (NC) leader and MP Aga Syed Ruhullah

title: Supreme Court assigns CBI plea on Shivakumar case to Justice Kant‚Äôs Bench
content: CBI filed the petition after Karnataka govt. revoked the consent given to the probe agency to investigate the disproportionate assets case against Shivakumar

title: Students launch protest in Dehradun against paper leak, says anti-cheating law is no deterrent
content: Demanding justice for those who spent months preparing for exams and ended up losing it to paper leak, students alleged that the anti-cheating law remain no deterrent for the cheating mafias in the State.

title: Uttar Pradesh government issues order prohibiting caste-based political rallies in State
content: Notification follows directive by Allahabad HC on Sept. 16 to curb glorification of caste¬†and its mention in police cases; Oppn. alleges BJP itself held caste rallies and conferences in the past

title: British PM¬†Keir Starmer likely to visit India in October
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Mr. Starmer will hold summit-level talks during the visit, which comes a little more than two months after Mr. Modi visited the U.K. to attend the signing of the U.K.-India free trade agreement.

title: Government announces ‚Çπ1,000 crore programme to drive innovation, entrepreneurial growth across Karnataka
content: The Department of Electronics, IT and BT on Monday unveiled a ‚Çπ1,000-crore¬†Local Economy Accelerator Programme (LEAP) to drive innovation across the State

title: Gang of four loots ‚Çπ1.5 crore from the house of professor in Bengaluru
content: The accused barged into the house claiming to be from the government and was conducting a search and seizure operation

title: Nine-year-old girl sexually assaulted by head of children‚Äôs home in Hosur
content: The police have arrested five persons in connection with the crime and attempt to cover it up. Among them are the director of the home, his wife, and a pastor of a local church

title: Canteens operated by Mahalir Thittam SHGs to be opened in Tamil Nadu‚Äôs government colleges
content: The institutions have been advised to allocate suitable space on the campuses to set up the canteens and ensure basic facilities such as water, electricity, and waste management support

title: Congress MLA‚Äôs call for coalition govt. after 2026 poll sparks divide in Tamil Nadu Congress Committee
content: Among a section of Congress functionaries, there is a feeling that the ruling DMK has kept allies at a distance, hardly consulting them or hearing their grievances

title: Following Allahabad HC‚Äôs directives, Uttar Pradesh prohibits caste mention in FIR, political rallies, public signs
content: Ordering a prohibition on caste-based rallies, officiating Chief Secretary (CS) Deepak Kumar said they are organised for political purposes and promote caste conflict in society, which is contrary to ‚Äúpublic order‚Äù and ‚Äúnational unity.‚Äù

title: "They Buy Politicians": Tibet Leader Warns India Of China's "Elite Capture"
content: In an explosive revelation, Dr Lobsang Sangay, the former President (Sikyong) of the Tibetan Government in Exile, has alleged that the Chinese Embassy in New Delhi has been actively trying to influence Indian politicians.

title: Gautam Adani Closes In On Asia's Richest Crown With $13 Billion Gain
content: Gautam Adani's fortune has soared by $13 billion over the last two trading sessions after India's markets regulator dismissed parts of a high-profile case against his conglomerate.

title: More Rain In 6 Hours Than Last 22 Days Combined: Why Kolkata Is Flooded
content: Between September 1 and September 22, Kolkata received 178.6 mm of rainfall, 16 per cent lower than the normal of 213.7 mm during this period. And between 8.30 am yesterday and 8.30 am today, the City of Joy received 247.4 mm of rain

title: Watch: Barack Obama Meets 102-Year-Old Woman, Asks About Her Secret To Longevity
content: Former US President Barack Obama interacted with a 102-year-old woman and couldn't resist asking her the secret to looking so good even at that age.

title: Noida Girl Collapses, Dies At School, Mother Appeals For "Justice" In Video
content: A Class 6 student in Noida died under mysterious circumstances after she collapsed during the teacher's day event at the school earlier this month, with her mother calling for justice in a now-viral video.

title: "Wish Some People Would Grow Up": Congress MP On Row Over 'Nepo Kids' Post
content: Senior Congress leader Manish Tewari's social media post about the regime changes in Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, and Nepal has landed him at the centre of a political row

title: Gangster Rohit Godara Calls Lawrence Bishnoi "Traitor", Claims Nexus With US Agency
content: In what appears to be a war between two rival gangs, Rohit Godara has accused Lawrence Bishnoi of being a traitor, claiming he colluded with an American agency and revealed sensitive information.

title: Recognition Of Palestinian State Offers No Relief For Gazans
content: Israel's military pushed deeper towards the most populated areas of Gaza City on Tuesday, a painful reminder for Gazans that Western powers' recognition of a Palestinian state does not mean an end to the horrors of war as tanks approach.

title: US Bars Iranian Diplomats From Costco, Luxury Shopping In New York
content: The Donald Trump administration has barred Iranian diplomats based in or visiting New York from accessing wholesale stores such as Costco or purchasing luxury goods in the US without approval from the State Department.

title: Dulquer Salmaan, Prithviraj Sukumaran's Houses Raided Over Luxury Car Tax Evasion
content: The raids were underway at 30 locations across Kerala, including Thiruvananthapuram, Ernakulam, Kottayam, Kozhikode, and Malappuram.

title: "Don't Want To Be Found": US Woman Goes Missing From Carnival Ship
content: The woman, identified as 47-year-old Jessica Collins, allegedly told the cruise company employees she "did not want to be found" before disembarking at Bonaire on September 17.

title: 2 Auto Drivers Arrested For Raping, Murdering Woman In Hyderabad
content: Cyberabad Police arrested two auto drivers today for kidnapping, raping and murdering a 32-year-old woman, whose body was found near a bridge in Hyderabadlast week.

title: On Camera, Telangana Cop Slaps Farmer Waiting In Queue For Hours Amid Urea Shortage
content: A police constable, Deshya Naik, was caught on camera slapping a farmer who was waiting in a long queue for urea at the Primary Agricultural Cooperative Society (PACS) office in Nalgonda district of Telangana.

title: "Had Responsibility": Kamala Harris Regrets Not Stopping Joe Biden's 2024 Presidential Run
content: Kamala Harris said Monday evening that she regrets not expressing her concerns about President Joe Biden running for a second term when a majority of Americans felt he was too old for the job.

title: Pune Ex-Banker Tricked With 'Amit Shah' Call By Relative, Duped Of 4 Crores
content: A 53-year-old retired bank employee was defrauded of Rs 4 crore by his relative, who posed as an intelligence officer and tricked him with a conference call with Union Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: All About Fat Bear Week, A Competition To Be The Chonkiest Brown Bear
content: After gorging all summer on sockeye salmon, the portliest brown bears on the Alaska Peninsula will battle it out to see who will be named the fattest of them all in the wildly popular online voting contest called Fat Bear Week.

title: Jagan Reddy's Party MP Seeks CBI, Judicial Probe Into Tirumala Temple Controversy
content: Maddila Gurumoorthy from Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party (YSCRP) expressed concern over allegations of theft and misuse of temple offerings, which he claims are politically motivated and unsubstantiated.

title: How Trump's $100,000 H-1B Visa Fee Could Impact US Economy More Than India
content: US President Donald Trump shook thousands of American dreams this weekend with an abrupt decision to slap a $100,000 fee on skilled worker permits - the H-1B visas.

title: Week 4 takeaways: Missouri shouldn't be overlooked; Ole Miss has depth at quarterback
content: we take a look at some surprising performances and where change could be needed . what changes might Clemson coach Dabo Swinney have to make in the offseason? what do they need to do to push themselves into college football playoff conversations?

title: Ten years of Kirby Smart at Georgia
content: a stranger approached a football coach to share a story about her daughter . she stepped outside to hear smart screaming at his players through a bullhorn during practice . the woman said she felt so much better that she wasn't in football practice, she said .

content: the Padres beat the Brewers 5-4 in the playoffs . the answer is a little different for every team, and the force of that pressure changes with each passing season . only the faithful are in a state of pure release, because L.A. won last year .
